2023-11-19T08:06:52Z: So, that was the Las Vegas GP. Plenty of pick through and digest, but we don't have too long to do it because the 2023 F1 finale is next weekend. We'll be back for the Abu Dhabi GP with opening practice on Friday. Until then, go well and enjoy the rest of your Sunday!
2023-11-19T08:03:14Z: Verstappen and co get busy with the fizzy, as the fireworks light up the Las Vegas night sky.
2023-11-19T08:00:54Z: As the clock strikes midnight local time and we move into Sunday, Verstappen gets his hands on the Las Vegas GP winners' trophy!
2023-11-19T07:59:39Z: The Dutch and Austrian national anthems ring out on the podium, with guests and VIPs now also on the track underneath the rostrum.
2023-11-19T07:58:13Z: The on-track podiums from the opening ceremony are back on the starting grid. So now the trophy presentations can begin.
2023-11-19T07:47:14Z: The podium trio have been taken to the Bellagio hotel fountains for the top three awards gathering. But first post-race interviews by David Coulthard.
2023-11-19T07:44:42Z:
Here's the Las Vegas GP race report: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-las-vegas-gp-verstappen-race-report/10548821/
    
Photo by: Andrew Ferraro / Motorsport Images
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19
2023-11-19T07:43:47Z: Perez's overalls, all red for a Vegas special, make this a really weird visual. Two reds suits separated by Verstappen's all-white one. They are being driven the podium, which appears to be halfway around the track.
2023-11-19T07:41:59Z: The podium trio climb into a Rolls Royce which has become an impromptu cooldown room. Good thing they are all friendly after this race as this would've been awkward.
2023-11-19T07:38:27Z: Verstappen gives a rendition of Viva Las Vegas over team radio in celebration before jumping out of the car and into the arms of his Red Bull crew. See, he does like Vegas after all!
2023-11-19T07:37:11Z: And the finishers outside of the points: P11 Gasly, P12 Albon, P13 Magnussen, P14 Ricciardo, P15 Zhou, P16 Sargeant, P17 Bottas. DNF: Tsunoda, Hulkenberg, Norris.
2023-11-19T07:35:40Z: Top 10 finishing order: Verstappen, Leclerc, Perez, Ocon, Stroll, Sainz, Hamilton, Russell, Alonso, Piastri.
2023-11-19T07:34:19Z: Verstappen wins and Leclerc takes second from Perez! What a finish! Russell finishes fourth on the road but drops to eighth with his five-second penalty.
2023-11-19T07:33:30Z: Leclerc goes for it! And gets it done! He passes Perez at Turn 14 on the final lap!
2023-11-19T07:32:37Z: Justin Bieber is ready with the chequered flag on the final lap. Verstappen is dropping back to give the slipstream to Perez to defend against Leclerc.
2023-11-19T07:32:13Z: Piastri makes his move as Gasly's miserable second half of the race continues. P10 for the McLaren driver now. Alonso is five-seconds up the road, so this may be as good as it gets.
2023-11-19T07:31:13Z: Another brief yellow flag as Tsunoda pulls off with a suspected gearbox issue.
2023-11-19T07:30:55Z: On the penultimate lap Leclerc isn't close enough to Perez to make a move. His chances are running out.
2023-11-19T07:30:42Z: Having only recently stopped, Piastri sets a new fastest lap of the race with a 1m35.490s. He's currently P11 but is closing quickly on Gasly to reach the all-important top 10.
2023-11-19T07:29:11Z: A brief yellow flag intervention as Hulkenberg pulls down a service road to retire.
2023-11-19T07:29:04Z: Verstappen has this race effectively won with a 4.5s lead. Leclerc is tucked up behind Perez with three laps to go to decide the order on the podium.
2023-11-19T07:28:35Z: A very simple move in the end for Hamilton. With DRS, he slides down the inside of Alonso at the end of The Strip. P8 now but that could become P7 after Russell's penalty is applied.
2023-11-19T07:27:15Z: Leclerc is within DRS range of Perez but, so far, isn't shaping for a move. Will he try to leave it late to deny the Mexican a chance to respond?
2023-11-19T07:26:59Z: In P8, Alonso has Hamilton on his gearbox. No history between this pair!...
2023-11-19T07:25:32Z: Hamilton makes a stunning move on Gasy through the final corner at close to 200mph. After lapping in the top five not too long ago, Gasly is falling back at a rate of knots.
2023-11-19T07:25:10Z: Verstappen is marching towards victory as he sets another fastest lap to push his lead to 3.8s over Perez. Leclerc is 1.1s behind the Mexican and has five laps to try to attack back.
2023-11-19T07:23:23Z: Piastri pits from fourth, having only run two sets of hard tyres, so needs to go to another compound. He picks the mediums and comes out in 12th.
2023-11-19T07:22:12Z: Leclerc outbrakes himself, then locks up, into Turn 14 and that gifts Perez second place.
2023-11-19T07:20:58Z: Verstappen's lead is up to 1.6s, as he is told to look after his front-right tyre by Red Bull, while Leclerc is keeping Perez at bay despite having no DRS to defend with.
2023-11-19T07:17:58Z: 10 laps to go and Leclerc has just fallen out of DRS range from Verstappen which leaves him exposed to Perez.
2023-11-19T07:17:32Z: The battle for P8 is getting rather spicy, with Russell moving to the front of the five-way battle, passing Albon. But within a lap, Albon loses further places to Sainz, Alonso and Hamilton. His tyres are toast.
2023-11-19T07:17:02Z: Another fastest lap from Verstappen but Leclerc is just keeping in DRS range. Red Bull tell their lead driver he's going to have to work hard to break the tow.
2023-11-19T07:15:06Z: Verstappen pumps in a fastest lap of 1m36.100s in his bid to break DRS from Leclerc. His lead is 0.8s but it is extending.
2023-11-19T07:13:50Z: What a move by Verstappen to take the lead! At Turn 14 he uses DRS to pull ahead up the inside of Leclerc and nails his braking to hold off the Ferrari fighting back on the outside.
2023-11-19T07:11:24Z: Perez just doesn't have the top speed to compete. He's overtaken by Verstappen around the outside before they even reach Turn 14. Verstappen is up to second and chasing Leclerc once again.
2023-11-19T07:09:56Z: Leclerc retakes the lead with an identical move at Turn 14 to dive the inside of Perez on lap 35.
2023-11-19T07:09:11Z: Leclerc as kept within DRS range of Perez but both have bigger worries behind with Verstappen charging towards them. Verstappen is still setting fastest laps and will catch them both in a lap or two.
2023-11-19T07:08:03Z: The Alpine pair are fighting for fifth and Ocon is told to hold position over team radio, but he's keeping the place ahead of Gasly as they go side-by-side.
2023-11-19T07:07:41Z: Rather quietly, Albon is racing in P7 for Williams and looks likely to pick up points while AlphaTauri are struggling in P17 and 19.
2023-11-19T07:06:19Z: Verstappen, up to fourth, isn't out of the picture at the front too. He's setting fastest laps for fun as he overtakes Piastri at Turn 14 to move up to third.
2023-11-19T07:04:52Z: Perez takes the lead! He dives up the inside of Leclerc at Turn 14 and places his car perfectly. Can Leclerc respond?
2023-11-19T07:03:09Z: That's our one and only tortured Vegas and gambling metaphor for this race.
2023-11-19T07:02:09Z: Perez is locked onto the rear of Leclerc and is looking for a move. In the home of gambling, the cards have fallen Perez's way so far with the safety cars, but can he check out with the biggest prize?
2023-11-19T06:59:28Z: Hulkenberg passes Ricciardo around the outside of Turns 3-4 for P15. That's not something you see all too often!
2023-11-19T06:59:07Z: Piastri makes a great move on Gasly into Turn 7 to take third place.
2023-11-19T06:58:28Z: Leclerc makes the jump coming out of Turn 16, keeping clear of Perez, who defends from Gasly into Turn 1.
2023-11-19T06:58:19Z: And there is the judgement. A five-second penalty for Russell.
2023-11-19T06:57:46Z: OPINION: Verstappen was significantly alongside heading through Turn 11 and deserved some space. However, there is only one real line through Turn 12 and two into one doesn't always go.Russell naively did not expect the dive but probably should have left space or been more aware.
2023-11-19T06:57:45Z: The safety car is in this lap, just as Leclerc almost drops his car on cold tyres. Here we go again!
2023-11-19T06:57:05Z: The Sphere is bright yellow with a 'safety car' banner to tell us what we already know. Thanks, Sphere.
2023-11-19T06:56:00Z: The incident involving Russell and Verstappen is now under investigation.
2023-11-19T06:55:30Z: Here's the new top 10 order behind the safety car: Leclerc, Perez, Gasly, Piastri, Verstappen, Ocon, Stroll, Albon, Russell, Sainz.
2023-11-19T06:53:59Z: So, Leclerc leads but has Perez directly behind on slightly fresher tyres. This has worked out really well for the Mexican.
2023-11-19T06:52:37Z: The safety car has been called to clear the debris from the track. Perez, Stroll, Verstappen, Russell, Sainz and Alonso all pit.
2023-11-19T06:52:30Z: Verstappen was clearly alongside and yes, he is alongside but that was a real 50-50.
2023-11-19T06:51:46Z: The safety car has been deployed!
2023-11-19T06:51:43Z: Front wing damage for Versappten as he accuses Russell of 'just pulling in on me'. No sign of an investigation yet.
2023-11-19T06:51:26Z: Leclerc has cleared Stroll amid the carnage behind so he is up to second and 11.2s behind Perez.
2023-11-19T06:50:23Z: After passing Sainz on the last lap, Verstappen is now all over Russell - and there's contact between the pair at Turn 12!
2023-11-19T06:48:28Z: The extra point is taken back from Verstappen, as Piastri registers a 1m37.763s. He's currently in P10 and 1.2s off Gasly, so would be eligible to claim the point.
2023-11-19T06:48:26Z: Perez leads Stroll by 9.3s, with Leclerc a further 2.1s back, so this race will now percolate between the one vs two-stoppers.
2023-11-19T06:46:13Z: So, Perez leads an F1 race for the first time since what feels like his last win back in Baku. Given he pitted so early due to damage you'd suspect he'll need to stop again, as will Stroll, so it is advantage Leclerc. But a safety car could flip this race entirely.
2023-11-19T06:45:23Z: Here comes Verstappen. He's back up to P7 and has just set a new fastest lap of the race with a 1m37.880s.
2023-11-19T06:44:19Z: Leclerc pits at the end of lap 21, swapping his mediums for hards in a 3.9s stop, and coms out in third behind Perez and Stroll.
2023-11-19T06:42:59Z: Leclerc is half a second slower than Perez per lap, as he continues on his aging mediums. Ocon pits to ditch his mediums to hards and comes out in 12th.
2023-11-19T06:40:41Z: McLaren Racing CEO Zak Brown has confirmed Piastri had suffered a puncture in the contact with Hamilton. He also says Norris is still in the medical centre being checked before returning to the team.
2023-11-19T06:39:14Z: Perez is flying on the hards, overtaking the yet-to-stop Ocon to get up to second place, and is just 14s off Leclerc.
2023-11-19T06:38:24Z: Pitstops aplenty now, as Gasly pits a later after Verstappen, and comes out in 10th and behind his former team-mate. Leclerc leads from Ocon and Perez.
2023-11-19T06:37:57Z: A puncture for Hamilton as the pits begin to get busy. The Mercedes driver dove for the inside to pass Piastri at the end of The Strip and made contact. Piastri pitted immediately with a shower of sparks.
2023-11-19T06:37:02Z: Verstappen serves his penalty in the pitstop and comes out in 11th.
2023-11-19T06:35:41Z: But not before Leclerc overtakes him on the track! Leclerc dives down the inside at Turn 14, and moments later Verstappen pits.
2023-11-19T06:35:02Z: Leclerc is attacking Verstappen, who says his tyres have fallen off the cliff. He's about to pit from the lead.
2023-11-19T06:34:24Z: Russell pits from third at the end of lap 15. He trades his mediums for fresh hards - the first time he's run this compound all weekend. Russell comes out in 13th.
2023-11-19T06:33:31Z: Piastri makes light work of Sargeant for P7, diving to the inside under braking at the end of The Strip. Hamilton follows the Australian through.
2023-11-19T06:33:17Z: Leclerc is pushing again and is within a second of Verstappen. This race is on!
2023-11-19T06:32:33Z: Perez is a man on a mission, setting a new fastest lap of the race with a 1m38.319s. He's less than a pitstop away from the leaders and has made potentially his only stop of the night already.
2023-11-19T06:32:34Z: Sargeant is being swallowed up by the pack now, losing places to Ocon, Piastri and Hamilton in the space of two laps. He's down to ninth.
2023-11-19T06:31:06Z: All the frontrunners are still on their starting medium tyres, which should go longer into the stint now due to the safety car earlier. Verstappen and Leclerc are trading fastest lap times at the front and the gap stays at 1.8s.
2023-11-19T06:29:55Z: Magnussen and Hulkenberg continue their traditional race-day slide down the order as Hamilton passes the former for P9. Hulkenberg pits after losing out to Perez.
2023-11-19T06:28:03Z: Leclerc is starting to come back to Verstappen, the gap down to 1.8s, as the Ferrari driver creates the gap time gap to Russell behind him. Gasly is still attached to Russell's rear wing.
2023-11-19T06:27:37Z: Hamilton moves into the top 10 along The Strip as he passes Hulkenberg.
2023-11-19T06:26:40Z: Piastri proves that overtaking is possible in Vegas to climb to P8. Soft tyres are beginning to run out of rubber as Tsunoda now pits for medium Pirellis.
2023-11-19T06:25:26Z: Verstappen has opened up his lead to 2.1s at the start of lap 10. Leclerc still has Russell and Gasly to think about directly behind him, effectively been dragged along with the aid of DRS.
2023-11-19T06:22:29Z: It was expected to be a case of switching the places back between Verstappen and Leclerc, but that penalty could weigh heavy on the Red Bull driver.
2023-11-19T06:21:21Z: Verstappen has been given a five-second penalty for forcing another driver off the track! Blimey.
2023-11-19T06:21:03Z: Undercut, overcut (wombling free)... What strategy would you be employing this weekend?
2023-11-19T06:20:51Z: Verstappen isn't hanging about, at the end of the seventh lap he leads by 1.8s from Leclerc who has Russell and Gasly on his tail.
2023-11-19T06:20:26Z: Sainz and Alonso - both on hards - are squabbling over P17 as Perez is ahead is also dragged into the fight. The trio could really do with working together at this stage to pull through the field.
2023-11-19T06:19:00Z: Verstappen has nailed the restart, as he often does, and gets darts clear of Leclerc. Off we go again!
2023-11-19T06:18:19Z: Drivers that have already stopped ahead of the restart - Stroll, Perez, Sainz, Alonso and Bottas. They are currently the bottom five runners.
2023-11-19T06:17:02Z: The safety car is coming in at the end of lap six.
2023-11-19T06:16:41Z: Ferrari has told Leclerc the race refs are still discussing his Turn 1 incident with Verstappen. Has it gone to VAR?
2023-11-19T06:15:27Z: Ah, more replays of the start and a penny for every time I've done this on F1 23. Alonso barrels down the inside of Turn one, misses the braking point and comes to a stop in front of Bottas. In the same incident, Perez made contact with the rear of Bottas' Alfa Romeo.
2023-11-19T06:13:19Z: After a frantic four laps, things will settle down behind the safety car. Verstappen still leads, no Turn 1 calls from race direction yet, ahead of Leclerc, Russell, Gasly and Albon.
2023-11-19T06:12:59Z: There we go. He lost the rear end of his car in Turn 11 and scraped along the outside wall causing sparks to fly as he made the race-ending trip to the TecPro barriers.
2023-11-19T06:11:41Z: Norris climbs out of his car rather gingerly as his rear-left Pirelli is sat next to his car. We'll need to see that again to tell you more.
2023-11-19T06:10:21Z: A big crash at Turn 12 as Norris causes sparks to fly. He hits the barrier at the end of the runoff and the safety car is deployed.
2023-11-19T06:09:39Z: Verstappen is quickly building his lead as DRS is enabled.
2023-11-19T06:09:25Z: Alonso appeared to spin by himself on lap one, Turn 1. Contact came when his car came to a halt in front of an AlphaTauri.
2023-11-19T06:07:43Z: Verstappen's Turn 1 move was very hard, neither driver stayed on the track, but it appears he'll keep the lead.
2023-11-19T06:07:30Z: As Perez leaves, in comes Alonso - also for a front wing change. The hard Pirelli rubber is bolted onto his Aston Martin.
2023-11-19T06:06:53Z: Alonso is reporting damage and in comes Perez for a new front wing.
2023-11-19T06:06:28Z: Verstappen leads at the end of the opening lap as a Virtual Safety Car is called for. There is debris around Turn 1.
2023-11-19T06:05:22Z: Chaos at the back as Alonso goes spinning with it appearing that Hamilton made contact with the Aston Martin into Turn 1. Sainz has also been turned around!
2023-11-19T06:05:00Z: Verstappen gets the better start, pushes Leclerc wide into Turn 1, but takes the lead! Leclerc slots into second and there is carnage behind!
2023-11-19T06:03:24Z: No Brazil-like woe for Leclerc as he leads the pack around to the grid without a fuss. Here we go...
2023-11-19T06:00:54Z: It is just 175m from pole to Turn 1, so this might be a tricky start. Leclerc leads away the formation lap.
2023-11-19T05:59:31Z: The formation lap is about a minute away, can Leclerc make it further than he did in Brazil last time out?
2023-11-19T05:58:18Z: Starting tyres: The majority are on mediums, but Hamilton, Zhou and Piastri have opted for hard tyres, while the back row pair of Stroll and Tsunoda start on the softs.
2023-11-19T05:56:33Z: Weather check: It is dry and chilly. The air temperature is 18C with the track just above at 18.9C. There's a slight breeze that is acting as a headwind down the long back straight before the drivers get back on the Strip.
2023-11-19T05:52:26Z: Right, the pre-race madness is over and now the serious business begins. Fifty laps of the Las Vegas Strip circuit to come.
2023-11-19T05:48:41Z: National anthem time! Donny Osmond is singing the US tune. His rendition is like a Christmas song performed in front of a roaring fire and a tree.
2023-11-19T05:45:33Z: There's running repairs going on to the rear wing of Verstappen's car amid the grid walk. All looks under control, unlike the grid.
2023-11-19T05:35:47Z: The grid is absolutely packed with stars, team members, media and hangers-on. No sign of the drivers, though, who are probably trying to avoid the stampede.
2023-11-19T05:34:24Z: For all of glitz and the glamour, let's take a brief moment pre-race to focus on the, er, racing. Many will target a one-stopper (assuming no safety car interventions) but tyre graining has been a major issue this weekend. It seems if the tyres fall out of the mystical window, it will trigger many into two-stops.
2023-11-19T05:28:12Z:
But there's been a bit of trouble in the pre-race festivities, one of the cars taking around the drivers on the parade has dropped fluid on the starting grid - right on Verstappen's second place slot. A clean up job has been undertaken.
    
Photo by: Filip Cleeren
2023-11-19T05:25:02Z: A mere 21 hours after qualifying finished, the race will, all being well, get going still on Saturday (in Vegas at least). The pitlane is now closed and all 20 drivers have made it to the grid - no pitlane starters, too!
2023-11-19T05:22:14Z: After nearly no running in FP1 (those pesky water valve covers) to no fans in FP2, the track action got back to normal for final practice and qualifying - resulting in Leclerc claiming pole in the early hours of Saturday morning.
2023-11-19T05:19:47Z: We are just a little over 40 minutes from lights out in Vegas. What a weekend it has been so far, with highs and lows, but can it finish with a final flourish?
2023-11-19T05:17:31Z: Welcome to the party! Here we go for the Las Vegas Grand Prix – the pitlane is open and the drivers are on the way to the grid.
